definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
variant of 閹|阉[yan1]/to castrate/variant of 淹[yan1]/to delay

sentences.chinese: 我有没人把任何重要人物给阉了。

sentences.english: This dish is made of hog meat, have a try!
sentences.chinese: 这道菜是阉猪肉做的，你尝尝鲜。

sentences.english: East dont hurt to make fox blunt marry two, if you dont promise to castrate him.
sentences.chinese: 东方不败让令狐冲娶两个，要是不答应就阉了他。

sentences.english: You won't get arrested if you have your cat castrated .
sentences.chinese: 如果你把你的猫给阉了，你也不会为此而被捕。

sentences.english: He was castrated, then the emperor abdicated.
sentences.chinese: 他被阉，紧接着皇帝退位。

sentences.english: I mean, you just don't want me to castrate you for my own benefit?
sentences.chinese: 我的意思说你是从我的利益出发而不想让我阉了你？

sentences.english: The GMSH authorities examined Chauhan and found that he has been castrated.
sentences.chinese: 这所医院当局对朝汗进行了检查，发现他被阉了。

sentences.english: A good broadcast company usually does far more than press releases.
sentences.chinese: 好的广播公司获褥信息的途径远不止新阉发布会。

sentences.english: The third think promotion clean body not thorough enough, decided to help the promotion yan.
sentences.chinese: 三子认为晋升净身未够彻底，决定帮晋升翻阉。

definition: to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
to execute on the spot (idiom); summary execution/to carry out the law on the spot
laws and discipline of imperial court
rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
